pageContext.claim: “Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador -- they're paid a lot of money. Every year, we give them foreign aid. And they did nothing for us. Nothing. They did nothing for us. So we give them tremendous amounts of money. You know what it is; you cover it all the time: hundreds of millions of dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has given substantial foreign aid to Central America over the last several years, but it has declined dramatically since Trump took office. All three countries were only allocated $88 million dollars in aid in 2018, down from a combined total of $499 million in 2016.
